CGame.cpp

00001 /*
00002  * CGame.cpp
00003  *
00004  *  Created on: 01.05.2009
00005  *      Author: gerstrong
00006  *  This Game-engine stripes down the main function
00007  *  and provides more dynamic control over the game
00008  */
00009 
00010 #include <stdlib.h>
00011 
00012 #include "CGame.h"
00013 #include "CLogFile.h"
00014 #include "sdl/CVideoDriver.h"
00015 #include "sdl/CInput.h"
00016 #include "sdl/CTimer.h"
00017 #include "sdl/sound/CSound.h"
00018 
00019 CGame::CGame() : m_firsttime(false),
00020 m_Engine(m_firsttime)
00021 {}
00022 
00023 //////////////////////////////////
00024 // Initialize Game Engine here! //
00025 //////////////////////////////////
00026 
00027 /**
00028  * \brief  This is the function where CG beings
00029  *
00030  * \param argc number of arguments
00031  * \param argv pointer to  char arrays where
00032  *      where the passed arguments are stored
00033  *      in the process
00034  * \return   If the function could setup
00035  *      the game, it will return true, else it
00036  *      will be false.
00037  *
00038  */
00039 bool CGame::init(int argc, char *argv[])
00040 {
00041  CSettings Settings(m_option);
00042  m_Engine.mp_option = m_option;
00043  
00044  // Check if there are settings on the PC, otherwise use defaults.
00045  if(!Settings.loadDrvCfg())
00046  {
00047   m_firsttime = true;
00048   g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"First time message: CKP didn't find the driver config file. However, it generated some default values and will save them now.<br>");
00049   Settings.saveDrvCfg();
00050  }
00051 
00052  if(!Settings.loadGameCfg()) Settings.loadDefaultGameCfg();
00053 
00054  // Setup the Hardware using the settings we have loaded
00055  g_pLogFile->textOut(GREEN,"Loading hardware settings...<br>");
00056  if(!loadCKPDrivers())
00057  {
00058   g_pLogFile->textOut(RED,"The game cannot start, because you do not meet the hardware requirements.<br>");
00059   return false;
00060  }
00061  
00062  // Initialize the way the launcher is started
00063  if(!m_Engine.init(argc, argv)) return false;
00064  
00065  return true;
00066 }
00067 
00068 /**
00069  * \brief     This function will try to load the hardware
00070  *      resources, which are the video driver and the sound.
00071  *      Input stuff is only loaded, when CG needs it, what mostly
00072  *      happens, when it has started.
00073  *
00074  * \return   If the function could load
00075  *      the drivers, it will return true, else it
00076  *      will be false.
00077  */
00078 // Load the driver needed to start the game
00079 bool CGame::loadCKPDrivers()
00080 {
00081  // initialize/activate all drivers
00082  g_pLogFile->ftextOut("Starting graphics driver...<br>");
00083  
00084  // The graphics are very important, if the other subsystems fail, warn but continue
00085  if (!g_pVideoDriver->start()) return false;
00086  
00087  g_pLogFile->ftextOut("Starting sound driver...<br>");
00088  g_pSound->init();
00089  
00090  // g_pInput is started automatically when needed!
00091 
00092  return true;
00093 }
00094 
00095 /////////////////////////////
00096 // Process Game Engine here! //
00097 /////////////////////////////
00098 /**
00099  * \brief     This is the main run cycle of the game,
00100  *      no matter what happens in the game logic or
00101  *      which engine is chosen, it always get to this point
00102  *      Mainly timer and logic processes are performed here.
00103  */
00104 void CGame::run()
00105 {
00106  CSettings Settings(m_option);
00107  do
00108  {
00109         // Perform game logic
00110         if (g_pTimer->TimeToLogic()) {
00111             // Poll Inputs
00112             g_pInput->pollEvents();
00113    if (g_pInput->getHoldedKey(KF) &&
00114     g_pInput->getHoldedKey(KI) &&
00115     g_pInput->getHoldedKey(KX))
00116    {
00117     Settings.loadDefaultGraphicsCfg();
00118     Settings.saveDrvCfg();
00119     g_pVideoDriver->stop();
00120     g_pVideoDriver->start();
00121    }
00122             // Process Game Control
00123             m_Engine.process();
00124         }
00125   
00126         // Render the Screen
00127         if (g_pTimer->TimeToRender()) {
00128          // Pass all the surfaces to one
00129          g_pVideoDriver->collectSurfaces();
00130          // Apply graphical effects if any
00131          g_pGfxEngine->process();
00132    // Now you really render the screen
00133          // When enabled, it also will apply Filters
00134             g_pVideoDriver->updateScreen();
00135         }
00136   
00137         // delay time remaining in current loop
00138         g_pTimer->TimeToDelay();
00139 
00140  } while(!m_Engine.mustShutdown() && !g_pInput->getExitEvent());
00141 }
00142 
00143 ///////////////////////////////
00144 // Cleanup Game Engine here! //
00145 ///////////////////////////////
00146 /**
00147  * \brief     This function cleans up all the used engines and the singleton
00148  *      classes that were used during the program. This can happen at the end of the program
00149  *      or when an engine may be changed.
00150  */
00151 void CGame::cleanup()
00152 {
00153  m_Engine.cleanupAll();
00154  
00155     g_pInput->Del();
00156     g_pSound->Del();
00157     g_pVideoDriver->Del();
00158     g_pTimer->Del();
00159 }
